selected_quotes: Nanoporous polyethylene could help keep us cool. Read the research
New nanofabric could create personal temperature-responsive bodysuits that make indoor heating a thing of the past
Radiative human body cooling by nanoporous polyethylene textile #textiles #nanotechnology
sciencemagazine: Nanoporous polyethylene could help keep us cool. Read the research: …

citation.abstract: Thermal management through personal heating and cooling is a strategy by which to expand indoor temperature setpoint range for large energy saving. We show that nanoporous polyethylene (nanoPE) is transparent to mid-infrared human body radiation but opaque to visible light because of the pore size distribution (50 to 1000 nanometers). We processed the material to develop a textile that promotes effective radiative cooling while still having sufficient air permeability, water-wicking rate, and mechanical strength for wearability. We developed a device to simulate skin temperature that shows temperatures 2.7° and 2.0°C lower when covered with nanoPE cloth and with processed nanoPE cloth, respectively, than when covered with cotton. Our processed nanoPE is an effective and scalable textile for personal thermal management.
citation.publisher: American Association for the Advancement of Science
citation.title: Radiative human body cooling by nanoporous polyethylene textile
